Title: AbstractConvert
Description: Convert text into an abstract
PromptText:
-> $a {"Create an abstract of the provided text, do not go over 8 sentences in length.
Do not generate a list of keywords. 
DO NOT GENERATE A LIST OF KEYWORDS.
$a"}

Title: ActiveVoiceRephrase
Description: Rephrase text from passive into active voice
PromptText:
-> $a {"In this text, rewrite any instances of passive voice to use active voice instead. Do not change any other aspects of the text: 
$a"}

Title: Anonymize
Description: Replace personally identifiable information in text with placeholders
PromptText:
-> $a {"Replace personally identifiable information in text with placeholders.

Input: John Doe, living at 123 Main St, Anytown, USA 12345, emailed from john.doe@email.com, and his Social Security Number is 123-45-6789. His phone number is (123) 456-7890.

Output: `NAME`, living at `ADDRES`,`CITY`, `COUNTRY` `POSTAL CODE`, emailed from`EMAIL`, and his Social Security Number is `SSN`. His phone number is `PHONE NUMBER`.
 Input: $a

Output:"}

Title: BreakGrammar
Description: Put grammatical errors into a piece of text
PromptText:
-> $a {"Make the given text grammatically incorrect.
DO USE improper punctuation (for example too many commas)
DO MAKE homonym swaps (for example: `which` into `witch` or `their` into `there` or vis-versa)
DO MAKE plural and possessive suffix swaps (for example `dogs` into `dog's`)
DO MISSPELL WORDS
DO MAKE the verb tense inconsistent.
DO NOT ALTER THE TEXT IN ANY OTHER WAY BESIDES BREAKING THE SPELLING AND GRAMMAR.
Text to break:
$a"}

Title: CallToActionSuggest
Description: Generate a catchy CTA to grab the attention of your audience
PromptText:
-> :$Text {"Review any text and give an actionable Call to Action that would catch the attention potential audiences.
You can use any form of punctuation and buzz terms that are popular in marketing, but do not make up any sales pitches that are not specifically mentioned.
Do not generate anything other than a Call to Action based on the provided text.
Respond only by suggesting calls to action that are deduced from any given block of text.
Keep your Calls to Action less than 10 words long.
Only generate the call to action, do not summarize the text.
Do not offer things as free or on sale unless it is specifically mentioned.
Do not make up benefits, sales, or discounts unless you are specifically told about them.
Only generate the Call to Action.
===
$Text"}

Title: CharacterList
Description: Create a list of characters from a block of text
PromptText:
-> $a {"Review the text below and identify a list of characters.
Create a bulleted list of each character in the text, one character per line.
After each character listed, place a colon and then a description of the character.
The description should include the character's personality, actions in the plot, general traits, and any other relevant information.
If the character's gender is mentioned in the text, include it in the description.

$a"}

Title: ClickbaitOptimizer
Description: Modify text to sound like clickbait
PromptText:
-> $a {"Modify the following text input so it sounds like a clickbait headline. 

Input Text: $a"}

Title: ClickBaitTitle
Description: Rewrite text as a clickbait style headline
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text as a clickbait style headline:

$a"}

Title: CodeReformat
Description: Reformat code so that is more human readable
PromptText:
-> $a {"Reformat the following Wolfram Language code by adding only spaces and new lines to make it more readable.

Do not add characters other than new lines or spaces.
Only include the formatted code.

===
$a"}

Title: CopyEdit
Description: Edit text for grammar, spelling, punctuation and clarity
PromptText:
-> $a {"Perform basic copy editing on the following text, correcting errors in grammar, spelling and punctuation; improvements to style and clarity may also be made, but do not make more significant changes to content or structure: 
$a"}

Title: Emojify
Description: Replace key words in text with emojis
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text and convert some of it into emojis.
The emojis are all related to whatever is in the text.
Keep a lot of the text, but convert key words into emojis.
Do not modify the text except to add emoji.
Respond only with the modified text, do not include any summary or explanation.
Do not respond with only emoji, most of the text should remain as normal words.

$a"}

Title: EmojiTranslate
Description: Translate text into an emoji representation
PromptText: -> $a {"Encode text using only emoji. You should be able to decode the message during an independent session. $a"}

Title: FormalRephrase
Description: Rephrase text in a formal way
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text using formal language. Respond with the corrected text and nothing else.

$a"}

Title: FTFY
Description: Use Fixed That For You to quickly correct spelling and grammar mistakes
PromptText:
-> $a {"Find and correct grammar and spelling mistakes in the following text.
Response with the corrected text and nothing else.
Provide no context for the corrections, only correct the text.
$a"}

Title: FunctionNameSuggest
Description: Suggest an alternative name for a given function
PromptText:
-> $b, $a {"Suggest a $b name for the following Wolfram Language (WL) function with the following rules: 

1. The function cannot start with a number.
2. The function cannot have an underscore in the name.
4. The first character of the function should be lower case.
3. Do not use the currently given name of the function as any sort of prompt.

Finally, reply ONLY with the function name and do not include a full stop.

===
$a"}

Title: GlossaryGenerate
Description: Generate a glossary for a given piece of text
PromptText:
-> $c, $b, $a {"Generate a sensible glossary of $c salient words in the given text. If a domain or criteria is supplied you can restrict the scope of glossary words to that domain. If no text is given, instead of giving a result, politely ask the user to supply it. If no restriction is supplied, proceed as normal. Return a list where each item is of the form '- word: definition' and each item is separated by an empty line.

Restriction: $b
Text:
$a"}

Title: GrammarReport
Description: Generate a list of grammatical errors in a given text
PromptText:
-> $a {"Review the following text for grammatical errors.
Generate a numbered list of corrections that can be made to the text. 
List one error per line and explain how it should be fixed. DO NOT REPRINT THE TEXT WITH CORRECTIONS. DO NOT GENERATE A CORRECTED VERSION OF THE TEXT
 $a"}

Title: HaikuVersion
Description: Summarize text as a haiku
PromptText:
-> $a {"You are HaikuVersion.
Your purpose is to take text and summarize it as a haiku.
You will strictly stick to replying in haiku format.
Your haikus will be relevant to whatever the user sends you.
You only return haikus based on:
$a"}

Title: HeadlineSuggest
Description: Suggest a headline for a text

Title: LegalDejargonize
Description: Rewrite text removing legal jargon

Title: LegalJargonize
Description: Rewrite text using legal jargon
PromptText:
-> $a {"Only use legal jargon when able. Rewrite the following text using legal jargon:

$a"}

Title: LinkedInConvert
Description: Rewrite text in the style of a LinkedIn post
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text as if it were a post on LinkedIn.
Treat the text as if it is being written directly by the character or author, and not as a quote.
Your response should meet the text constraints of a LinkedIn post.
Only rewrite the text provided.
DO NOT GENERATE ADDITIONAL COMMENTARY.
DO NOT REFERENCE THE ORIGINAL TEXT'S AUTHOR OR REFER TO IT AS A QUOTE.
DO NOT REFER TO THE FICTIONAL PROPERTY FROM WHICH A TEXT MAY COME FROM.
You may append the text with appropriate hashtags.
You may add emoji to the text.
Your response should incorporate the input text.
DO NOT MAKE A GENERIC LINKEDIN POST.

$a"}

Title: LOCTopicSuggest
Description: Suggest a Library of Congress topic classification for the subject matter of a piece of text
PromptText:
-> $b, $a {"Suggest a Library of Congress subject heading classification for the following text. 
Suggest no more than $b possible classifications for the text. 
Subject Headings should be as specific as possible, using geographic and temporal subdivisions where applicable.
Do NOT produce a bulleted list.
Do NOT produce a numbered list.

Examples of acceptable, correctly formatted suggestions include:
Johnson, Lyndon B (Lyndon Baines), 1908-1973
United States -- Politics and government -- 1963-1969
Presidents -- United States -- Election -- 1968
Presidents -- United States -- Biography
Viking antiquities -- Denmark -- Riba
Excavations (Archaeology) -- Denmark -- Riba
Riba (Denmark) -- Antiquities

The text to suggest subject headings for is:
$a"}

Title: LongerRephrase
Description: Rephrase the text in a longer way

Title: LyricsSuggest
Description: Create songs with given topics or texts based on a particular style
PromptText: -> $a, $b {"Write a song about $a in the style of $b."}

Title: Memeify
Description: Convert text into meme-worthy material
PromptText:
-> $a {"Only take in text and return it as a meme.
Do not go off topic or add extra input in your responses. 
Only create memes based off of the text provided, do not go off topic.
Only convert text into memes.
Memes can be recent or old, but only use widely known and popular memes.
If an image is being referenced, refer to it in brackets below the meme text.
Take the following text and convert it into a meme
===
$a"}

Title: Moodify
Description: Rewrite text with a specific mood

Title: NarrativeToResume
Description: Rewrite narrative text as a resume
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text as a 1 page resume in reverse chronological order. Use the categories "professional summary", "work experience", "education", and "skills" to structure the resume:

$a"}

Title: NarrativeToScript
Description: Rewrite a block of prose as a screenplay or stage play
PromptText:
-> $b, $a {"Rewrite the following prose into a script, in the style of a $b.
Use script formatting, using stage or camera directions.
Format character and setting descriptions appropriately.
Make sure character names are in all caps.
DO NOT write in paragraph format.

$a"}

Title: PunAbout
Description: Generates a pun given a subject matter
PromptText:
-> $a, $b {"Generate a pun using the following text as the subject matter.
Do not always format the pun as a joke.
Do not explain the pun.
Do not duplicate a pun.
Do format the answer as a complete sentence.
Do not include profanity or sexual innuendo in the output.
$a
provide $b answers.
"}

Title: QuestionAnswerAssess
Description: Determine the correctness of an answer to a question
PromptText:
-> $a, $b {"Your task is to determine the correctness of the answer to a question. 
The question and answer are both given below. 
Determine if the answer is correct for the question and why.
Respond with valid JSON of the form:
	{
	"Correct":true,
	"Explanation":"explanation"
	}

-----Question-----
$a

-----Answer-----
$b"}

Title: RecipeSuggest
Description: Create a recipe while controlling ingredients and more
PromptText:
-> $b, $c, $a, $d {"Do not include any of these ingredients: $b

Try to include these ingredients: $c
Write a recipe for or including $a.

$d"}

Title: Rephrase
Description: Rewrite text
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text using different words. Respond with the corrected text and nothing else.

$a"}

Title: ResumeToNarrative
Description: Rewrite a resume as narrative text
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following resume as a narrative summary of a career. The summary should be no longer than three paragraphs and present the career in a flattering manner.

$a"}

Title: SensitivityAnalyze
Description: Review text for sensitive content
PromptText:
-> $b, $a {"Analyze the text below and offer a sensitivity analysis based on the contents; this means review the content and give a report on which themes may be offensive for readers.
If none of the content appears to be sensitive, denote it as such.
Do not offer long explanations, do not converse.
When possible, use softer words; for example if a text discusses decapitation, just summarize it as death.
Combine similar items such as violence and war.
The sensitivity analysis should be templated with a header stating 'Analysis' followed by bullet marks that highlight the themes that some users may be sensitive to, similar to a trigger warning.
The report should focus mainly on topics that are generally found to be offensive, sensitive or break guidelines according to:
$b

The text to review:
$a"}

Title: SentimentAnalyze
Description: Analyze the sentiment across a text

Title: ShorterRephrase
Description: Rephrase the text in a shorter way

Title: Summarize
Description: Summarize provided text

Title: SummarizeURLContent
Description: Summarize the contents of a provided file or URL
PromptText:
-> $a {"Please summarize the contents of the given URL or file.

###PATH###
$a

###CONTENTS###
Cell[BoxData[TemplateBox[{RowBox[{StringTake, [, RowBox[{RowBox[{Import, [, RowBox[{RowBox[{TemplateSlot, [, 1, ]}], ,, "Plaintext"}], ]}], ,, RowBox[{UpTo, [, 10000, ]}]}], ]}], General, TextData}, NotebookTemplateExpression]]]"}

Title: TargetAudience
Description: Word your response for a target audience

Title: TitleSuggest
Description: Suggest a title for a given text
PromptText:
-> $b, $a {"Suggest a clear, compelling title for a/an $b, based on the given text. The title should be of an appropriate length, style, and structure for the specified type of work.
Keep journal and article titles long.
Keep novel, movie, and album titles short.
Titles DO NOT need to pull words directly from the text.
Create a title based on:

$a"}

Title: TLDR
Description: One sentence summary
PromptText: -> $a {"Reduce the following long text to a short one sentence summary, the shorter the better:$a"}

Title: TranscriptionCleanUp
Description: Remove ums, uhs, and other filler words to make sentences flow better
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text: $a
Removing ONLY the filler words.
DO NOT change the meaning of the text.
DO NOT change any other words in the text.
DO NOT remove any other words.
DO NOT make the text sound more formal. 
For example, DO NOT change "like" to "such as." In this case, "like" should NOT be changed to any other word.
ONLY remove the word "like" if it is being used as a filler word.
If "like" is being used as a preposition, conjunction, noun, or adjective, do NOT change or remove it.
Make NO OTHER edits to the text."}

Title: Translated
Description: Write the response in a specified language

Title: TriviaQuizGenerate
Description: Question and answer generation on any topic
PromptText:
-> $b, $c, $a {"Generate $b amount of questions and answers.
 Number each pair of questions and answers. Make the difficulty rating of the questions $c.
Difficulty should be judged on what level of knowledge would be needed for the subject. Easy should be for anyone with a precursory knowledge, Master should be for people who are devoted to the study of the subject.
Format your responses as so: (Number) Q: (text with questions)  A: (text with answers)
Only generate questions and answers based around the subject of: $a"}

Title: TweetConvert
Description: Rewrite text to post on twitter
PromptText:
-> $a {"Rewrite the following text to be suitable to be posted on Twitter:

$a"}

Title: VariableNameSuggest
Description: Suggest a alternative name for a variable in a given block of code
PromptText:
-> $c, $b, $a {"Suggest a $c name for the variable $b based on the following Wolfram Language (WL) code with the following rules: 

1. The variable cannot start with a number.
2. The variable cannot have an underscore in the name.
4. The first character of the variable should be lower case.
3. Do not use the currently given name of the variable as any sort of prompt.

Finally, reply ONLY with the variable name and do not include a full stop.

===
$a"}

Title: WolframSampleCode
Description: Create an example of Wolfram Language code using a specific symbol
PromptText:
-> $a {"Input: Plot
Output: Plot[Sin[x]/(1+Cos[x]},{x,0,Pi}]

Input: D
Output: D[Log[x^4+x,x]]

Input: CloudObject
Output: Information[CloudObject["MyDeployment"],"Permissions"]

Input: $a
Output:"}

Title: WordOrigin
Description: Finds the etymology of a given word
PromptText: -> $a {"Find the etymology of the following word: $a"}
